page.title: 06Farming
page.content: Dairy farming has been the traditional way of farming this area over the years but was revolutionised last year by the introduction of the milk quota by the E.E.C. Most farmers had to cut their milk production, some selling part of their herd, others cut down on feeding, bought in concentrates and bought less fertilisers. Everyone has to think of ways to help their living. The dairy farmers did not produce calves to the same extent but rather using a beef bull, produced calves for beef. Some farmers turned to sheep which made sheep very dear and now we see more sheep in the district than for years. There have been many ideas and it is still too soon to know which one was best, but it is plain that most farmers have found it necessary to have a sideline rather than stick to one enterprise.
